org.melior.service.mongo

Class MongoCollection<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.melior.service.mongo.MongoCollection<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MongoRequestInterceptor

    public class MongoCollection<T>
extends Object
    A MongoDB collection which is registered with a MongoListener for processing. If a SingletonProcessor is provided when the collection is built, then any new managed items that are added to the collection will be processed by the MongoListener individually.

    If a BatchProcessor is provided when the collection is built, then any new managed items that are added to the collection will be processed by the MongoListener in batches of the configured size.

    If both a BatchProcessor and a SingletonProcessor are provided when the collection is built, then the MongoListener will use the SingletonProcessor as a fall-back when processing of a batch fails.

    If a BatchProcessor is provided then the implementer must ensure that processing of a batch of items either succeeds atomically or fails atomically.

    Since:
    2.3
    Author:
    Melior
    See Also:
    BatchProcessor, SingletonProcessor

    • Method Detail

      • batch

        public MongoCollection<T> batch(org.melior.service.work.BatchProcessor<T> batchProcessor)
        Set batch processor. New arrivals in the collection will be batched and processed together. It is the responsibility of the calling application to ensure that the batch either succeeds atomically or fails atomically.
        Parameters:
        batchProcessor - The batch processor
        Returns:
        The Mongo collection

      • single

        public MongoCollection<T> single(org.melior.service.work.SingletonProcessor<T> singletonProcessor)
        Set singleton processor. New arrivals in the collection will be processed individually.
        Parameters:
        singletonProcessor - The singleton processor
        Returns:
        The Mongo collection
